intro: Agalinis edwardsiana, commonly known as the Edwards' bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its blooming period occurs during the summer months, producing clusters of blue to purple flowers. Agalinis edwardsiana is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a short-lived perennial.
